item.title: Money Talks: Decoding Financial Jargon with The Reformed Broker Josh Brown | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 6/2/23 One of the biggest obstacles for new investors isn’t finding the money‚Äî you can invest with as little $20. The bigger obstacle is the language. Wall Street is jam-packed with jargon that makes the financial world seem way more complicated than it actually is. To decode some of the terms you‚Äôve heard in the headlines, Nicole calls up Josh Brown, AKA the Reformed Broker. Nicole and Josh take you from alpha to liquidity and everything in between.

item.title: Should You Dump Your Bank for a Credit Union? | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 1.30.23 And, WTF is a credit union anyway? Nicole reveals all. Transcript

item.title: Would You Pay $4,000 to Get Over Your Ex? | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 1/20/23 Nicole stumbled across an article about a $4,000 breakup bootcamp and immediately needed to know more. First of all, $4,000 is a lot of money. But, it got her thinking: breakups can affect your mental health, which in turn, can affect your financial health. So what’s the price of a healthy life? If it isn‚Äôt $4,000, how much is it? Nicole invites the bootcamp founder Amy Chan to talk about her program and all things at the intersection of love and money.

item.title: Money-Making Opportunities From COP28 Climate Resolution | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description This week, nearly 200 national representatives met in Dubai for the 28th United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, also known as COP28. This is one of the most consequential events of the year - and not just for the climate, but also for your wallet. Pretty much everything your money touches is attached to an invisible sustainability question. Today, Nicole explains three money moves you can make to benefit from the COP28 resolution.

item.title: Hear Me Out: Why Writing Your Eulogy Can Help You Meet Your Financial Goals | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description As we look to 2024, we’re beginning to make our financial New Year’s resolutions. Nicole has an unusual routine that helps her get in the spirit: she thinks about her eulogy. Today, she explains why that’s not as morbid as it sounds, and how it helps her stay motivated to reach her goals. Plus, Nicole is joined by expert motivational speaker Natasha Graziano who shares her own practice, scripting, she uses to make‚Äî and meet‚Äî her goals.

item.title: How Getting a Puppy Can Boost the Economy | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description In this weekly roundup of the biggest headlines on Wall Street and how they affect your finances: where we stand with fixing the economy, pet supply stores are having a rough go (but there’s an easy fix…) and the Santa Claus Rally is coming to the stock market. Want to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? Go to moneyassistant.com and meet Magnifi, your AI money assistant, designed to help you make a plan for your financial goals.

item.title: From Holiday Gifts to New Year's Parties, Here's the Best Money Tips | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Tis the holiday season and it‚Äôs‚Ä¶ expensive. There are gifts to buy, family to see, and parties to attend. If you‚Äôre lucky, it‚Äôs an embarrassment of riches‚Ä¶ that can also leave you totally broke. Today, Nicole gives you some fresh tips for saving money during the holidays. To get Nicole’s tips on holiday travel, click here. Want to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? Go to moneyassistant.

item.title: How To Deprogram Stress with Chief Mindfulness Officer at TIFIN, Thomas Droge | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description In recent years, there‚Äôs been significant conversation around burnout and how to beat it. From those conversations, we know that mindfulness has a place in our work‚Ä¶ but how literal should that be? According to Thomas Droge, the Chief Mindfulness Officer at Tifin, it should be pretty literal. Nicole talks to Thomas about why we all need a mindfulness officer. Plus, Thomas takes Nicole‚Äî and now, you‚Äî through a mindfulness exercise that will help you reduce stress.

item.title: Investing 101 at The New York Stock Exchange with The Einstein of Wall Street Peter Tuchman | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 1.05.23 Nicole heads to the New York Stock Exchange to talk with Peter Tuchman, AKA The Einstein of Wall Street. There, they confirm the rumors: the Wolf of Wall Street days are over. Peter reveals what it’s really like working on Wall Street, how to protect yourself from scammy finance “pros” and how to navigate the market successfully. You can find more on Peter (including some of the famous NYSE photos) here: https://www.

item.title: How This Company Beat Amazon | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 1.23.23 Jim McKelvey and Jack Dorsey created the payment tool Square to fix a problem small businesses had with credit card transactions. In the early days of Square, Amazon made a competing tool. For most small businesses, that usually means the beginning of the end. But not for Square. Jim and Jack did the unthinkable: they beat Amazon. Jim tells Nicole how they did it through what Jim calls Innovation Stack.

item.title: 5 Ways To Save on Holiday Travel | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description An estimated 160 million Americans are planning to travel for the holidays. If you’re one of them, here are five ways you can save on one of the busiest‚Äî and most expensive‚Äî travel times of the year.¬†ÔªøWant to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? item.title: Vivian Tu on Why She's Your Rich BFF‚Äî But Not Your Finfluencer | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Money talk entering the mainstream is a great thing, but the world of “finfluencing” has a dark side. Money content on social media operates like the Wild West‚Äî with far fewer rules than on Wall Street. Today, Nicole sits down with financial educator Vivian Tu to talk about the good, the bad, and the ugly of finfluencer-land. They talk about the ‚Äúfinancial advice‚Äù that keeps them up at night, how to confirm if a financial educator is legit, and they play a game of financial “never have I ever” that you should totally try at home.

item.title: Greed on Trial, Branson's Backup and Tax Hacks | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description In this week’s roundup of the biggest headlines on Wall Street and how they affect your finances: the Supreme Court hears arguments about the Sackler family’s personal liability in the opioid crisis, Sir Richard Branson announces he won’t be making any more investments in Virgin Galactic and Uber’s big day. Want to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? Go to moneyassistant.com and meet Magnifi, your AI money assistant, designed to help you make a plan for your financial goals.

item.title: Legal Loopholes the Rich Use To Get Richer‚Äî and You Can Too! | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Former President Trump is currently facing several charges of financial crimes, including fraud. These allegations are full of examples of what not to do, but the legal versions of what Trump was attempting are tried and true strategies the rich use to get richer. Nicole shares these perfectly legal loopholes‚Äî and yes, you can try these at home with no fines or mug shots! Transcript

item.title: Elon Musk Told Advertisers To "F‚Äîk Themselves," Here's Our Hot Take | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Last week, three industries: AI, electric tech and social media began to shift‚Äî possibly forever‚Äî and Elon Musk is at the center of all of it. Today, Nicole answers the question: what does it mean for us, as investors, when one person has so much influence over the global economy? Plus, she gives her hot take on Elon‚Äôs message to the advertising world to, “go f‚Äîk yourself.” Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Today Nicole gives you the playbook for major savings when it comes to health insurance and medical bills. Plus, she decodes some of the common alphabet soup in health insurance (HSAs, FSAs, WTF?). Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Do you have a problem that‚Äôs nagging at you? That might be the exact thing that puts you on the path to starting a business. This is what Nicole is talking about today with Lane Merrifield, one of the cofounders of the beloved children‚Äôs game Club Penguin. Nicole and Lane talk about the most important considerations for anyone making products for kids‚Äî and, beyond that, advice for any entrepreneur solving a problem.

item.title: How the Latest Ransomware Attack Could Affect Your Real Estate Deal | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description On this week’s roundup of the headlines and how they affect your finances, Nicole decodes: the ransomware attack on Fidelity National Financial, the big drama at the huge crypto exchange Binance and how the Super Bowl of the shopping season went down for big retailers. ÔªøWant to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? Go to moneyassistant.com and meet Magnifi, your AI money assistant, designed to help you make a plan for your financial goals.

item.description: Podcast Description Iliza Shlesinger is one of the most accomplished and talented comedians in the world and today, she comes on the show to talk comic-onomics, the economics of comedy. Iliza tells Nicole about the money lessons she’s learned throughout her career, how she’s avoided the temptations around keeping up with the Joneses and the easy hack she uses to save extra money. Check out Iliza on tour! Find when she’s coming to your city here: https://iliza.

item.title: Need-To-Know Money Lessons from the WNBA with Nneka Ogwumike | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description The business of sports is going through a revolution‚Äî and the transformation is perhaps the most dramatic at the WNBA. Today Nicole speaks to Nneka Ogwumike, a player for the LA Sparks and the President of the WNBA Players Association. Nicole and Nneka talk about the growth of the WNBA, why being compared to the NBA isn‚Äôt actually helpful, and the difficult position these players are in after Britney Griner was held in Russia.

item.description: Podcast Description Mara S. Campo drops in to fill Nicole in on the amazing Money Rehab she’s been up to. Listen up to learn how you can make her money moves! For more on Mara, find her on IG @marascampo Transcript

In their conversation, Jason and Nicole share true panic-inducing stories of failure, and how gratitude helped them turn that failure into success.

item.description: Podcast Description On this week’s roundup of the biggest headlines on Wall Street and how they affect your finances, Nicole decodes the Sam Altman drama with ChatGPT and OpenAI, Musk’s latest lawsuit and some good news on inflation… finally! Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description The stock market can feel unfamiliar‚Äî but if you look around, your next super investment is closer than you think… literally. item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 11/8/21 You might think mindfulness is bogus, but it actually has benefitted both Nicole‚Äôs emotional health and her career decisions. Listen to how mindfulness has helped Nicole, and how it can help you with your finances. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 6/21/21 Today Nicole answers the listener question: ‚ÄúHow do I ask for a raise without causing bad blood between me and my employer?‚Äù Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 5.25.21 Nicole gives you three steps to take your woodworking/travel blog/macrame empire from part-time to big-time. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description You‚Äôve probably seen your favorite Instagram celebrity talk about entering their ‚Äúvillain era," which feels like it‚Äôs probably only good for reality TV villains. Corinne tells Nicole why she thinks being a villain is actually a good thing, the money trail of The Bachelor and gives advice all of us can use next time we need to advocate for ourselves.

Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description It’s open enrollment szn and you know what that means! Advice to help you get the smartest medical insurance plan for you, of course. Nicole gives you all the best tips‚Äî including one that will definitely blow your mind. Transcript

item.title: How To Take Control of Your Finances with Supermodel Kim Alexis | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Kim Alexis is a nutrition guru, but she started her career as one of the first supermodels‚Äî and managing the financial side of that did not come with an instruction manual. Today, Nicole and Kim talk about what it felt like to hit it big so young, to live in the infamous model apartments, and the money challenges that came when people in her life took advantage. And lastly: the easiest way someone can take the reins of their financial life‚Äî even when imposter syndrome strikes.

item.title: Plot Twist: Inflation May Help You | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 7/5/22 For some folks, inflation is actually helping their net worth. To see if you’re one of the lucky few, tune in! Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description A listener wrote to Nicole asking for advice: her father-in-law has high medical bills that he can’t afford, and he can’t get additional assistance from Medicare‚Äî which means his healthcare costs will fall to her. How can she stay afloat? Nicole walks her through the options she has to shoulder the financial burden. Want to start investing, but don’t know where to begin? item.title: Can There Be Peace in Israel? with Ambassador Ron Prosor | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Last week, the United States House of Representatives passed a plan to provide $14.3 billion in aid to Israel. So, clearly, the conflict in the Middle East will continue to be a big headline in financial news. A few weeks ago, Nicole interviewed Dan Senor, a foreign policy expert, who said that Israel is a country uniquely primed for resilience. But as the war wages on in Israel, resilience feels like it‚Äôs far away‚Äî or even impossible.

item.description: Podcast Description For a long time, if someone had a story to tell, they’d say they “have a book” in them. Now, they “have a Netflix show” in them. Today, Nicole unpacks the actual process of getting a show on a streamer with Ryan Kalil. Ryan is a former professional football player‚Äî he primarily played with the Carolina Panthers and was a¬†three-time All-Pro. Now, Ryan is in the production world.

item.description: Podcast Description Today, we‚Äôre talking about funny business. Not like the Sam-Bankman-Fried-on-trial-for-fraud, funny business. But legit funny business. The business of comedy. item.description: Podcast Description In recent weeks, there has been a ton of money news that is nothing short of‚Ä¶ ridiculous. Steelo is an art collector, a comedian, a restaurant investor, a musician, and, yes - one of the hosts of MTV‚Äôs Ridiculousness.

Watch SoFi’s Face of Finance video referenced by Nicole and Anthony here: https://www.

item.title: This Debt Hack Can Save You Time and Money | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 9.27.21 You may have heard that debt consolidation is one option to help get that debt monkey off your back. Today‚Äôs episode is all about unpacking the nitty gritty of debt consolidation, and how to decide whether it‚Äôs the right move for you. Transcript

item.title: How Do I Make a F%*king Budget?! | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 4.15.21 Nicole covers exactly how much should go toward your essential spending, what the heck you have to put toward retirement, and how much you get to spend on the fun stuff: vacations and bottomless-mimosa brunches. Transcript

item.title: A Personal Update | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Hi friends, it’s Nicole. In today’s episode, I wanted to check in on you. I wanted to take a moment to give you space to reflect on how you‚Äôre feeling amidst all the darkness that‚Äôs going on in the world, and also, give you a sense of where I‚Äôm at with Money Rehab… Transcript

item.title: How Powerful Cryptocurrency Really Is In the Wrong Hands | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description There’s an assumption that cryptocurrency is particularly useful to bad actors and terror organizations… but how true are these assumptions? This is a question on the top of Nicole’s mind as she continues to follow the money trail of Hamas’ terrorist attack in Israel. To help her answer this question, Nicole speaks with Ari Redbord, the Global Head of Policy at the blockchain intelligence company TRM Labs. Transcript

item.title: War Insurance, Spotting Profiteers and Making Big Things Happen with Jordan Fried | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Jordan Fried was fully living the entrepreneur life in Puerto Rico… until the attack in Israel happened on 10/7. Then, Jordan found himself chartering, and then boarding, a plane to deliver aid to Israel. To make an impact on the ground in Israel, Jordan and his cofounders started their nonprofit Israel Friends‚Äî and casually seeded it themselves with a couple million bucks. But as Jordan will tell you, you don‚Äôt need a million dollars to make a difference.

item.title: Why There Will Never Be a "Real Housewives of Tel Aviv" with Lizzy Savetsky | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description While she hopes she’s wrong, Lizzy Savetsky doesn’t think there will ever be a Tel Aviv spinoff of the “Real Housewives” reality TV franchise. Lizzy’s uniquely fit to answer this question; she was cast as a member of the Real Housewives of New York, but received so many hateful and antisemitic messages, she decided to remove herself from the cast. Nicole and Lizzy talk about what that experience felt like, which television shows do a good job of representing the Jewish experience and which ones fall short, and what it was like for Lizzy to be in Israel with her children on the day of the terrorist attack.

item.title: A Former IDF Soldier's Advice on How To Support Israel | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description 360,000 army reservists were called up after the attacks in Israel on October 7th; but VC partner and former IDF soldier Levi Aron would argue, we were all called up. Nicole and Levi unpack the many different ways we can all stand up to support the causes we care about‚Äî with our wallets, our social media accounts, our companies, and more. Find the statement from the VCs standing with Israel here:¬†https://docs.

item.title: Why Speaking Your Values Is Good Business with Dr. Sheila Nazarian | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description It’s human to feel afraid to speak out on an issue that is surrounded by anger and division‚Äî especially at a time when people are getting fired and backlash for voicing those opinions. But according to Nicole, it’s good business; and Nicole’s guest today, Dr. Sheila Nazarian, can prove it. Find Sheila’s fundraiser for FIDF (Friends of the Israel Defense Force) on her Instagram @drsheilanazarian Transcript

item.title: Politicians Got You Down? Here's What You Can Do | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know who you‚Äôre voting for? And more importantly, what they stand for? Trust us, in the next elections‚Äî hate will be on the ballot, so make sure you‚Äôre not voting for it. Beyond donating to political campaigns, you can also run in them. That‚Äôs what Consuelo Hernandez did, a Jewish Latina politician who is currently serving as a member of the Arizona House of Representatives. Today, Nicole shares a sneak preview of Consuelo’s episode on MNN’s Money Maker | Mi Mundo Rico podcast hosted by Nely Gal√°n where Consuelo gives a roadmap of how you can get involved in local politics‚Äî as a politician, or as a citizen - and why several acts of violence against her family drove her to choose a life in politics, and make a difference.

item.title: Why the War in Isreal Helped Me Realize I Want Kids | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description It sounds counterintuitive, but it’s true‚Äî and it comes from Nicole’s reflections on Israel’s resilience and wondering: what does the path to rebuilding look like? To unpack the question of Israel’s future, Nicole is joined by author and foreign policy expert Dan Senor. Their conversation spans the startup landscape in Israel, the question of aid from the United States, how a country in an unstable region could rank so highly on happiness and yes, Nicole’s realization that she wants to have kids.

item.title: Can You Get Fired For Social Media Posts? | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description In a word: yes. We’re seeing it play out right now. Multiple high-profile people have lost their jobs after making insensitive comments about Israel on social media. The internet wants to know: is that legal?! On Nicole’s other podcast, Help Wanted, her and her cohost call up lawyer and workplace legal expert Peter Rahbar to help us understand our rights as employees… and employers. Never miss an episode and subscribe to Help Wanted here: https://link.

item.title: Dark Money Has Infiltrated American Campuses - Here's How To Make Sure Your Money Is Clean | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description Your money is a vote; but it’s not just where you spend it that matters, it’s also where it comes from. Nicole knows people who have taken jobs at companies with iffy ethics and investments from nefarious sources. Do the ends justify the means? Nicole explores that question with Dr. Charles Small, a terrorism finance expert who founded the Institute for the Study of Global Antisemitism and Policy. Dr.

item.title: How Global Crisis Affects Your Investments | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin
item.description: Podcast Description To help explain how the war in Israel affects you and your money, Nicole calls up Peter Tuchman, broker on the New York Stock Exchange, and host of the Money News Network podcast Trade Like Einstein. item.title: When Talking Politics on Social Media Is a Terrible Idea‚Äî and When It's Not | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin

In this episode, Jason and Nicole tackle a question the whole internet is asking: should we be talking about politics on social media? Some argue we have a responsibility to share our beliefs, while others believe social media is not the best forum to affect change.

item.title: The Money Trail of the Terrorist Attacks in Israel | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin

To help us do that, we turn to Emmy award-winning veteran journalist Mosheh Oinounou. item.description: Podcast Description We had a plan for Money Rehab this week. But then the attacks in Israel happened. Transcript

item.title: How To Invest in History with Darren Rovell | Money Rehab with Nicole Lapin

item.description: Podcast Description Originally aired 7/21/22 In the second part of Nicole’s conversation with artist Skylar Grey, Skylar shares how she found love after her divorce, and the amazing engagement story you may just want to try at home. Transcript
